citation.article-title: Catellatospora, a new genus of the Actinomycetales.

p.s: Description of Catellatospora ferruginea sp. nov.
Catellatospora ferruginea (fer.ru.gin'e.a. L. adj. ferruginea rust colored)
Orange colony mass, particularly on oatmeal agar and Hickey-Tresner agar.
Melanin pigment is produced on tyrosine agar (ISP 7).

Utilizes adonitol, L-arabinose, D-fructose , D-galactose, D-glucose, lactose, D-mannose, D-mannitol, melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, salicin, starch, sucrose, and D-xylose.
No growth on erythritol or myoinositol.
No growth in the presence of 3% NaCl.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 70.9 ± 0.5 mol%.
The type strain of C. ferruginea is IFO 14496T (6257-C).
